revised_title: Early Pleistocene Marine Molluscan Assemblages in East Anglia
tldr: This study examines the marine mollusk assemblages in the Early Pleistocene of Sidestrand, Bramerton, and the Royal Society borehole at Ludham, Norfolk. The author defines a series of mollusk assemblage zones and attempts to interpret the ecological and depositional environment in which they accumulated. The findings provide insights into the climate and marine conditions during the Early Pleistocene in East Anglia.
